economic_impact: This measure is expected to have a positive economic impact by enhancing patient safety and increasing the efficiency and adaptability of the pharmacy workforce. By establishing a regulatory framework, the bill supports the expanded roles for technicians, such as administering immunizations, which can improve public health outcomes. This proactive regulation helps Hawaii's healthcare system align with national standards, potentially avoiding costs associated with falling behind in care delivery.
policy_impact: This measure builds upon Act 104 of the 2024 legislative session, which expanded the scope of practice for pharmacy technicians to include the administration of immunizations. By requiring registration, this bill provides the necessary regulatory oversight to support such advanced roles. It solidifies the professionalization of pharmacy technicians and ensures a standardized level of accountability.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update is the inclusion of an economic impact statement, which was previously absent, highlighting benefits to patient safety and workforce efficiency. Additionally, the policy impact has been updated to explicitly connect this registration requirement to the expanded technician roles authorized under Act 104 of 2024. No new information was provided in the updated documents to alter the previously established fiscal details, such as appropriations, revenue sources, or multi-year cost projections.
